Specifically, it was found that the 'hybrid' method of mixing blue fluorescent and phosphorescent materials combined the long lifespan of fluorescent materials and the high efficiency of phosphorescent materials to achieve a lifespan equivalent to existing OLED.

LGD develops ‘dream OLED material’ blue phosphorescent panelIt is known that LG Display's panel uses a blue phosphorescent material from Universal Display (UDC), an American display materials company. LG Display is expected to begin mass production through development cooperation with UDC.

Welcome to OLED.   Not knowing your entry basis, I should be careful.  But regardless, I apologize for Al.  Frankly, the post is offensive.  

OLED is a VERY financially strong company and the (by far) majority player in the industry with over 5500 patents. 

You will find some extremely knowledgeable folks here regarding blue and I will leave it to them for the tech details.  But the business end is this.  OLED currently has emitters in Red and Green.  2/3 of RGB displays.  The B or blue is proving very difficult to bring to commercial specs but it WILL happen.  Listen or read the CC call of yesterday. 

The problem is they have been holding the blue carrot in front of investors for a long time.  The recent run up I feel has been based on the anticipated blue coming to market and unfortunately has been pushed back again.  But it’s in its final R&D stages. 

But blue is not the only thing to focus on.  Growth of existing revenues is strong and merits your long position.  Be patient.  I am sure today doesn’t feel very good.  But OLED will benefit you in the coming months.
Sorry but I am a relative newcomer and long, but do not understand the comments on the color blue. What do I need to know?

“We reiterate our Buy rating on Universal Display Corp (UDC), a pure OLED material and
IP play focusing on Asian panel makers as customers. Management slightly raised 2024
revenue guidance from US$635-675mn to US$645-675mn (just lower-end increased),
expecting more positive impact from new demand (new OLED for tablet, etc). Since
Asian panel makers are expected to increase their OLED capacity/production through
2H24 and 2025-26

Low impact of slightly missed 2Q OP and blue material

up 8% YoY). However, OP/NP/EPS were 5%+/- lower due to slightly higher-than-
expected COGS and opex. That said, 2Q results revealed upcycle level of GM (76%) and

Slight miss on top and bottom, very slight.  BUt they did lift guidance mid point very slightly.  CC will be telling.

Total revenue in the first half of 2024 was $323.8 million - if you take the high end guidance of 675 million, it would average 175 million for the last two quarters of the year. And you know UDC lowballed it.

H1 YoY is noteworthy.  Material sales in particular:

Total revenue in the first half of 2024 was $323.8 million as compared to $277.0 million in the first half of 2023.

Revenue from material sales was $188.7 million in the first half of 2024 as compared to $147.3 million in the first half of 2023. The increase in material sales was primarily due to strengthened demand for our emitter materials.

“With leading OEMs embarking on their OLED IT journey with the introduction of new OLED PC products, we believe that a new multi-year capex cycle has commenced to support this growth. As the broadening proliferation of OLEDs across the consumer landscape fuels the market’s positive trajectory, we are enhancing our operational and strategic infrastructure and fortifying our leadership position in the ecosystem. This new chapter in our long-term growth story is expected to usher in tremendous opportunities for the industry and for us.”
